s_section_title: Theft
s_section_text: Whoever intending to take dishonestly any movable property out of the possession of any person without that persons consent moves that property in order to such taking is said to commit theft
explain: A thing so long as it is attached to the earth not being movable property is not the subject of theft but it becomes capable of being the subject of theft as soon as it is severed from the earth
illustration: A cuts down a tree on Zs ground with the intention of dishonestly taking the tree out of Zs possession without Zs consent Here as soon as A has severed the tree in order to such taking he has committed theft
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years or with fine or with both. In cases where the value of stolen property is less than five thousand rupees and person is convicted for the first time shall be punished with community service

s_section_title: Snatching
s_section_text: Theft is snatching if in order to commit theft the offender suddenly or quickly or forcibly seizes or secures or grabs or takes away from any person or from his possession any movable property
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Theft in dwelling house or transport
s_section_text: Whoever commits theft in any building tent or vessel used as human dwelling or for custody of property or of any means of transport or from any means of transport or of idol or icon in place of worship or of any property of Government or local authority
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Theft by clerk or servant
s_section_text: Whoever being a clerk or servant or being employed in the capacity of a clerk or servant commits theft in respect of any property in the possession of his master or employer
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Theft with preparation for violence
s_section_text: Whoever commits theft having made preparation for causing death or hurt or restraint or fear of death or hurt or restraint to any person in order to committing such theft or effecting escape or retaining property
illustration: A commits theft on property in Zs possession and while committing this theft he has a loaded pistol under his garment having provided this pistol for the purpose of hurting Z in case Z should resist
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Extortion
s_section_text: Whoever intentionally puts any person in fear of any injury to that person or to any other and thereby dishonestly induces the person so put in fear to deliver to any person any property or valuable security
illustration: A threatens to publish a defamatory libel concerning Z unless Z gives him money He thus induces Z to give him money A has committed extortion
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Robbery
s_section_text: In all robbery there is either theft or extortion Theft is robbery if in order to committing the theft or in committing the theft or in carrying away property the offender voluntarily causes or attempts to cause death or hurt or wrongful restraint
explain: The offender is said to be present if he is sufficiently near to put the other person in fear of instant death of instant hurt or of instant wrongful restraint
illustration: A holds Z down and fraudulently takes Zs money and jewels from Zs clothes without Zs consent Here A has committed theft and in order to the committing of that theft has voluntarily caused wrongful restraint to Z A has therefore committed robbery
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall also be liable to fine and if robbery be committed on highway between sunset and sunrise imprisonment may be extended to fourteen years

s_section_title: Dacoity
s_section_text: When five or more persons conjointly commit or attempt to commit a robbery or where the whole number of persons conjointly committing or attempting to commit a robbery and persons present and aiding such commission amount to five or more every person so committing attempting or aiding is said to commit dacoity
punishment: Imprisonment for life or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Robbery or dacoity with deadly weapon
s_section_text: If at the time of committing robbery or dacoity the offender uses any deadly weapon or causes grievous hurt to any person or attempts to cause death or grievous hurt to any person
punishment: Imprisonment shall not be less than seven years

s_section_title: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed
s_section_text: Whoever attempts to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with any deadly weapon
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Punishment for belonging to gang of robbers
s_section_text: Whoever at any time after the passing of this Act shall have been habitually associated with any other or others for the purpose of committing robbery or dacoity
punishment: Imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Dishonest misappropriation of property
s_section_text: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use any movable property
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Dishonest misappropriation by clerk or servant
s_section_text: Whoever being in any manner entrusted with property or with any dominion over property dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use that property or dishonestly uses or disposes of that property in violation of any direction of law prescribing the mode in which such trust is to be discharged
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Criminal breach of trust
s_section_text: Whoever being in any manner entrusted with property or with any dominion over property dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use that property or dishonestly uses or disposes of that property in violation of any direction of law
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Stolen property
s_section_text: A person is said to receive property knowing it to be stolen property when he receives property which he knows or has reason to believe to be stolen property
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Cheating
s_section_text: Whoever by deceiving any person fraudulently or dishonestly induces the person so deceived to deliver any property to any person or to consent that any person shall retain any property or intentionally induces the person so deceived to do or omit to do anything which he would not do or omit if he were not so deceived
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Cheating by personation
s_section_text: A person is said to cheat by personation if he cheats by pretending to be some other person or by knowingly substituting one person for or another or representing that he or any other person is a person other than he or such other person really is
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property
s_section_text: Whoever with intent to cause wrongful loss to creditors or to defraud creditors dishonestly or fraudulently removes conceals or delivers to any person or transfers or causes to be transferred any property
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Dishonestly or fraudulently preventing debt being available for creditors
s_section_text: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently prevents any debt or demand due to himself or to any other person from being made available according to law for payment of his debts or the debts of such other person
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer
s_section_text: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently signs seals or executes or is concerned in signing sealing or executing any deed or instrument which purports to transfer or subject to any charge any property or any interest therein
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors
s_section_text: Whoever with intent to defraud creditors or to prevent the property from coming to or being made available for his creditors dishonestly or fraudulently conceals or removes any part of his property or disposes of the whole or any part of his property
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Mischief
s_section_text: Whoever with intent to cause or knowing that he is likely to cause wrongful loss or damage to the public or to any person causes the destruction of any property or any such change in any property or in the situation thereof as destroys or diminishes its value or utility or affects it injuriously commits mischief
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Mischief by killing or maiming animal
s_section_text: Whoever commits mischief by killing poisoning maiming or rendering useless any animal
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Mischief by injury inundation fire or explosive substance
s_section_text: Whoever commits mischief by any act which causes or which he knows to be likely to cause a diminution of the supply of water for agricultural purposes or for food or drink for human beings or for animals or for the purpose of cleanliness or for carrying on any manufacture
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years or with fine or with both

s_section_title: Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a rail road bridge or causeway
s_section_text: Whoever commits mischief with intent to destroy or to render unsafe a railroad or a bridge viaduct or causeway or any other structure which if destroyed or rendered unsafe would endanger human life
punishment: Imprisonment for life or with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Punishment for intentionally running vessel aground or ashore with intent to commit theft
s_section_text: Whoever intentionally runs any vessel aground or ashore intending to commit theft of any property contained therein or to dishonestly misappropriate any such property or with intent that theft or misappropriation of any such property may be committed
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Criminal trespass and house-trespass
s_section_text: Whoever enters into or upon property in the possession of another with intent to commit an offence or to intimidate insult or annoy any person in possession of such property or having unlawfully entered into or upon such property commits an offence or intimidates insults or annoys any such person commits criminal trespass
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months or with fine which may extend to five thousand rupees or with both

s_section_title: House-trespass and house-breaking
s_section_text: Whoever commits criminal trespass by entering into or remaining in any building tent or vessel used as a human dwelling or any building used as a place for worship or as a place for the custody of property is said to commit house-trespass
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Punishment for house-trespass or house-breaking
s_section_text: Whoever commits house-trespass shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: House-trespass in order to commit offence
s_section_text: Whoever commits house-trespass in order to the committing of any offence punishable with death or with imprisonment for life or with imprisonment
punishment: For offence punishable with death: imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment not exceeding ten years and fine. For offence punishable with imprisonment for life: imprisonment not exceeding ten years and fine. For offence punishable with imprisonment: imprisonment up to two years and fine. Provided that if intended offence is theft imprisonment may be extended to seven years

s_section_title: House-trespass after preparation for hurt assault or wrongful restraint
s_section_text: Whoever commits house-trespass having made preparation for causing hurt to any person or for assaulting any person or for wrongfully restraining any person or for putting any person in fear of hurt or of assault or of wrongful restraint
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall also be liable to fine

s_section_title: Dishonestly breaking open receptacle containing property
s_section_text: Whoever dishonestly or with intent to commit mischief breaks open or unfastens any closed receptacle which contains or which he believes to contain property
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years or with fine or with both
